docs.snippet: EYEFUL TOWER Something new in the way of exotica has been added to Nirvana, the picturesque Indian restaurant occupying the penthouse at 30 Central Park South. Regular patrons are familiar with the restaurant's tentlike decor, the sweeping park pa...
docs.lead_paragraph: EYEFUL TOWER Something new in the way of exotica has been added to Nirvana, the picturesque Indian restaurant occupying the penthouse at 30 Central Park South. Regular patrons are familiar with the restaurant's tentlike decor, the sweeping park panorama visible from the terrace tables and the music indigenous to India, now supplied by Shyam Yodh and Badal Roy on the sitar and tabla.

docs.snippet: When they bundle into their furs and scarfs to leave the showrooms where summer collections are being shown, most viewers are smiling. That isn't because Seventh Avenue is less frigid than any place else. It's because, collectively, the clothes ar...
docs.lead_paragraph: When they bundle into their furs and scarfs to leave the showrooms where summer collections are being shown, most viewers are smiling. That isn't because Seventh Avenue is less frigid than any place else. It's because, collectively, the clothes are the liveliest and gayest in years.

docs.snippet: Survivors of Nazi death camps have been called "collectors of justice." They seek something beyond economic or social restitution something closer to acknowledgment of crimes committed against them and punishment of those responsible. In order to ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Survivors of Nazi death camps have been called "collectors of justice." They seek something beyond economic or social restitution something closer to acknowledgment of crimes committed against them and punishment of those responsible. In order to re-establish at least the semblance of a moral universe. Their feelings can of course include hunger for revenge, but I think the more fundamental impulse is toward a reconstruction of meaning, toward a sense of justice.
docs.abstract: Rev of Howard Blum book Wanted! The Search for Nazis in America

docs.snippet: His barbed, seared voice is that of the contentious pink pad of TV's SOS commercials. In fact, the pink pad's voice is Broderick Crawford's, and he admits it unashamed. "Hell, for an actor it's doughnut-hunting time forever. The take-the-money-and...
docs.lead_paragraph: His barbed, seared voice is that of the contentious pink pad of TV's SOS commercials. In fact, the pink pad's voice is Broderick Crawford's, and he admits it unashamed. "Hell, for an actor it's doughnut-hunting time forever. The take-the-money-and-run days never end! But this week, kid, it's steak and champagne."
